result.execSummary:
The defendant Mariah Sylvia Niles was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operate with Restricted Controlled Substance (1st w/ Minor Pass < 16 yrs.), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Court costs due during probation term. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, in addition to all other enforcement sanctions available to the court, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.

-AODA and any counseling/treatment deemed appropriate.
-Absolute sobriety.
-No controlled substances or prescription medication unless prescribed by physician and in conformity with said prescription.
-Random tests.
-Submit DNA sample.
-Pay supervision fees.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Clerk is informed defendant made substantial payment and balance due is $21.10. Clerk removes probation review hearing on 4/20/2017, DOC contacted.
Probation review hearing on April 20, 2017 at 03:00 pm.
To probation supervisor regarding unpaid court ordered financial obligations, copy to defendant.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Defendant Mariah Sylvia Niles in court with attorney Robert Olmr.  Jeffrey A Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant enters guilty plea to the complaint. Court examines defendant, finds her guilty and renders sentence. Court denies defendant's request to expunge case.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 2, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Mariah Sylvia Niles in court with attorney Robert P Olmr.  Shannon M. Whitworth appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Olmr appearing for Atty. Vizanko. Atty. Olmr requests another date for plea/sentencing. Bail to continue.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 2, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Order to Report to Ozaukee County Sheriff's Department

Conditions set by court: Absolute sobriety,  no controlled substances or prescription medication unless prescribed by physician and in conformity with said prescription, no possession of drug paraphernalia.

Defendant Mariah Sylvia Niles in court with Attorney Lisa Vizanko.  Jeffrey A Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Counsel waives reading of the complaint and enters a plea of not guilty. State makes bail recommendations. Court accepts plea and sets bail.
Further proceedings scheduled for March 24, 2016 at 01:45 pm.
